measured_by: bid magnitude in a Becker-DeGroot-Marschak (BDM) auction
justification: After viewing the six sources, "participants placed a bid corresponding to the maximum cost they would be willing to pay in order to see the extra information (BDM auction — between 0 cents and 5 cents)". The authors repeatedly analyse how this bid size indexes "participants' desire for more information", treating bid magnitude as the measure of information-seeking.

In the confidence experiments, participants "provided a confidence rating corresponding to how likely they believed their choice was to be correct on a continuous scale ranging from 0 to 100." These slider ratings are analysed as the quantitative measure of subjective decision confidence.

measured_by: proportion of correct colour choices (selecting the winning colour)
justification: Participants chose which colour they believed would win, and "correct choices were rewarded with 15 cents"; throughout the results, the authors report "choice accuracy (i.e., frequency of choosing the winning colour)" as the outcome variable, using the proportion of correct selections to index accuracy.
